result.execSummary:
The defendant Tavirus Terrell Moore Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any sentence defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavirus Terrell Moore Jr

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tavirus Terrell Moore Jr. via video in custody at DCI and by Attorney Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Reading of Information waived.  Court accepts not guilty plea for purposes of arraignment.  Resolution reached with joint recommendation.  State moves to dismiss citations in 22FO586, 22FO587 and 22TR1765 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Counsel provided court forms to obtain defendant's signature and return to Clerk of Courts.
Per Atty. Jaeger, defendant transferred from MSDF to Dodge Correctional.  Video appearance arranged with Dodge Correctional for 9/02/2022 at 10:00 a.m.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tavirus T. Moore Jr. in court and by Atty. Jeffrey Jaeger.  (Citations tagging:  22FO586, 22FO587 and 22TR1765)   WITNESS:  Deputy Thomas Boisvert (WCSD).  Per request of State, Court takes judicial notice of Milwaukee County Case 16-CF-4246.  State moves for bind over.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No possess of controlled substances without a valid prescription; No possess of firearms; Absolute sobriety

Clerk BMC; Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tavirus T Moore Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Tavirus T Moore Jr. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. State requests $750 cash bond. Def on PO Hold. Court sets $2000.00 bond. Def does not waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
